A **demilich**, L, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The demilich is a somewhat stronger type of [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)") that is [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless") and has enhanced [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") like other liches.

A demilich has a [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") touch attack and will attempt to cast one mage [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") during each of their turns. Demiliches possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Demiliches are [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat, which primarily comes up if they are [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Demiliches that are not [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") can raise monsters killed by them as [zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)") of the corresponding type; if they have one, they will be raised 5-20 turns after they are initially killed. This also applies to [you](/wiki/You "You") if you are polymorphed into a demilich. They will also [grudge](/wiki/Grudge "Grudge") living monsters that can be turned into zombies.

Monsters with [digestion](/wiki/Digestion "Digestion") attacks can gain [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") from swallowing monsters whole, making it possible for them to gain cold resistance from a demilich that is digested.

Per [commit d963c6dd](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/d963c6dd6f3a5921acf4d4a9a6e46525b29aeeee), a demilich's touch attack deals reduced physical damage (2d4) if used against a cold-resistant target.

## Generation

Randomly-generated demiliches are always hostile. A [lich](/wiki/Lich "Lich") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a demilich, and a demilich can grow up into a [master lich](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich").

A demilich [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") when killed - if killed by any method that ordinarily leaves a corpse, a message is printed about their body crumbling to dust.[\[1\]](#cite_note-dusted-1)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

A demilich may appear in the central chamber of the mausoleum [themed room](/wiki/Themed_room "Themed room").

[Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") monster generation is adjusted so that no master or arch-liches can be created using class-specific monster generation, making demiliches the strongest and most likely type of lich to generate there at level creation. A demilich may still grow up into a master lich if they come across or generate with a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level"), or else kill enough of the living denizens to gain the necessary HP.

If a genocided monster with a pre-grown form (that is not explicitly a baby form) would be created by the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") monster spell, and this form is not also genocided, it will appear in place of the genocided monster; this also happens if the chosen nasty is inappropriate for the location, such as an arch-lich outside Gehennom (which will typically create a demilich in its place).

## Strategy

Demiliches will often cast [curse items](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items"), [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)") and [drain strength](/wiki/Drain_strength "Drain strength"); they can also [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties"), and it is possible for a demilich to be generated at a high enough level to cast the [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death") - thankfully, this is rare to encounter before reaching [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). Even so, the summon nasties spell may make it difficult to put space between you and a demilich approaching your position, and demiliches are somewhat faster than standard liches at 9 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") (or 12 after casting [haste self](/wiki/Haste_self_\(monster_spell\) "Haste self (monster spell)")).

As with other liches, [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") makes fighting demiliches far more bearable, though it will not stop them summoning nasties spell or using the [aggravate](/wiki/Aggravate "Aggravate") monster spell, which can awaken other monsters that you were hoping to avoid or leave for later fights. Having fast speed or better can help put space between you and a demilich, and a quick and reliable source of ranged damage paired with a way to scare off groups of summoned nasties can help to prevent being overwhelmed. [Stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"), [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") and [digestion](/wiki/Digestion "Digestion") will finish off a demilich quickly, and a blessed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") can take care of lich problems altogether.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The changes to the demilich's touch attack enables them to damage and kill cold-resistant monsters.

## History

The demilich first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Lich](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lich "wikipedia:Lich")***

In fantasy works and media, a lich (which comes from the Old English *līċ*, meaning "corpse" or "body") is a type of undead creature. Previously used as recently as early 20th-century fantasy fiction to refer to any corpse (animate or otherwise), media such as *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")* has spurred the portrayal of liches as powerful undead spellcasters that are proficient in necromancy, and typically undergo the transformation in order to defy death, allowing them to retain their intelligence and magical abilities and command lesser undead.

Where the liches of *Dungeons & Dragons* are depicted as revenants with undecaying and cadaverous, desiccated or completely skeletal bodies that are still tethered to the physical realm in some manner, the demilich is instead a floating skull or other skeletal body part (quite unlike the demilich of *NetHack*) that uses astral projection to travel across other planes of existence, often as a result of attaining enough knowledge to transcend the need for a body. A lich can become a demilich by replacing eight small pieces of its body with soul gems - this usually takes the form of jeweled eyes and teeth in the lich's skull, but can also be joints in a hand or discs in the lich's spine. Once the power of the lich is focused in that part of its body, the rest of it crumbles away.

Demiliches in the *Dungeons & Dragons* settings are even more resilient to destruction than normal liches, and boast even stronger magical defenses as well. The eight gems effectively act as the demilich's phylactery, allowing the demilich to reappear within ten days of its "death" unless all eight gems and the phylactery are destroyed. One of the settings' most notorious demiliches is [Acererak](/wiki/Acererak "Acererak"), who is responsible in-universe for the construction of the similarly-infamous [Tomb of Horrors](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomb_of_Horrors "wikipedia:Tomb of Horrors").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), demiliches [need a +3 or better weapon](/wiki/Need_%2Bx_weapon_to_hit "Need +x weapon to hit") to be hit, and [hit monsters as a +3 weapon themselves](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

Demiliches may appear among the random L generated in the [Chaotic Quest](/wiki/Chaotic_Quest "Chaotic Quest").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), two demiliches appear within one of the rooms in [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")'s lair if his dwelling appears as [the third Abyss level](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine_Flats#Demogorgon.27s_palace "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), players killed by any type of lich will arise as a [revenant](/wiki/Revenant "Revenant") instead of a [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files.

Two demiliches are generated on the first two floors of [Vecna's Domain](/wiki/Vecna%27s_Domain "Vecna's Domain") at level creation, and three are generated around Vecna's lair on the third floor, including one in a hidden storeroom that is generated atop an [iron safe](/wiki/Iron_safe "Iron safe") with two chests next to them; all the containers will have random loot. Vecna's presence in the dungeon prevents the genocide of demiliches - once he is destroyed, they can be subjected to genocide as normal.

Demiliches are much more dangerous compared to vanilla *NetHack*, since they have access to several new monster spells especially at higher levels - like with other liches, this also makes them much better pets and polyforms, with full access to their repertoire of monster spells when fighting other monsters.

Sunsword now has a chance of instakilling any demiliches it hits. [The Sword of Kas](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Kas "The Sword of Kas") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone") [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") sword that deals double damage versus L, including demiliches.

## Encyclopedia entry

But on its heels ere the sunset faded, there came a second apparition, striding with incredible strides and halting when it loomed almost upon me in the red twilight-the monstrous mummy of some ancient king still crowned with untarnished gold but turning to my gaze a visage that more than time or the worm had wasted. Broken swathings flapped about the skeleton legs, and above the crown that was set with sapphires and orange rubies, a black something swayed and nodded horribly; but, for an instant, I did not dream what it was. Then, in its middle, two oblique and scarlet eyes opened and glowed like hellish coals, and two ophidian fangs glittered in an ape-like mouth. A squat, furless, shapeless head on a neck of disproportionate extent leaned unspeakably down and whispered in the mummy's ear. Then, with one stride, the titanic lich took half the distance between us, and from out the folds of the tattered sere-cloth a gaunt arm arose, and fleshless, taloned fingers laden with glowering gems, reached out and fumbled for my throat . . .

\[ The Abominations of Yondo, Clark Ashton Smith, 1926 ]

A demilich has a [[cold]] touch attack and will attempt to cast one mage [[monster spell]] during each of their turns. Demiliches possess [[cold resistance]], [[sleep resistance]] and [[poison resistance]].

Demiliches are [[poisonous]] to eat, which primarily comes up if they are [[digest]]ed by another monster.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Demiliches that are not [[cancelled]] can raise monsters killed by them as [[Zombie (monster class)|zombies]] of the corresponding type; if they have one, they will be raised 5-20 turns after they are initially killed. This also applies to [[you]] if you are polymorphed into a demilich. They will also [[grudge]] living monsters that can be turned into zombies.

Monsters with [[digestion]] attacks can gain [[intrinsic]]s from swallowing monsters whole, making it possible for them to gain cold resistance from a demilich that is digested.

Per {{commit|d963c6dd6f3a5921acf4d4a9a6e46525b29aeeee}}, a demilich's touch attack deals reduced physical damage (2d4) if used against a cold-resistant target.}}

==Generation==
Randomly-generated demiliches are always hostile. A [[lich]] can [[grow up]] into a demilich, and a demilich can grow up into a [[master lich]].

A demilich [[Corpseless|never leaves a corpse]] when killed - if killed by any method that ordinarily leaves a corpse, a message is printed about their body crumbling to dust.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|2083|nethack=3.6.7|name="dusted"}} 

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|A demilich may appear in the central chamber of the mausoleum [[themed room]].

[[Castle]] monster generation is adjusted so that no master or arch-liches can be created using class-specific monster generation, making demiliches the strongest and most likely type of lich to generate there at level creation. A demilich may still grow up into a master lich if they come across or generate with a [[potion of gain level]], or else kill enough of the living denizens to gain the necessary HP.

If a genocided monster with a pre-grown form (that is not explicitly a baby form) would be created by the [[summon nasties]] monster spell, and this form is not also genocided, it will appear in place of the genocided monster; this also happens if the chosen nasty is inappropriate for the location, such as an arch-lich outside Gehennom (which will typically create a demilich in its place).}}

==Strategy==
Demiliches will often cast [[curse items]], [[Destroy armor (monster spell)|destroy armor]] and [[drain strength]]; they can also [[summon nasties]], and it is possible for a demilich to be generated at a high enough level to cast the [[touch of death]] - thankfully, this is rare to encounter before reaching [[Gehennom]]. Even so, the summon nasties spell may make it difficult to put space between you and a demilich approaching your position, and demiliches are somewhat faster than standard liches at 9 [[speed]] (or 12 after casting [[Haste self (monster spell)|haste self]]).

As with other liches, [[magic resistance]] makes fighting demiliches far more bearable, though it will not stop them summoning nasties spell or using the [[aggravate]] monster spell, which can awaken other monsters that you were hoping to avoid or leave for later fights. Having fast speed or better can help put space between you and a demilich, and a quick and reliable source of ranged damage paired with a way to scare off groups of summoned nasties can help to prevent being overwhelmed. [[Stoning]], [[disintegration]] and [[digestion]] will finish off a demilich quickly, and a blessed [[scroll of genocide]] can take care of lich problems altogether.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The changes to the demilich's touch attack enables them to damage and kill cold-resistant monsters.}}

==History==
The demilich first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Lich}}
In fantasy works and media, a lich (which comes from the Old English ''līċ'', meaning "corpse" or "body") is a type of undead creature. Previously used as recently as early 20th-century fantasy fiction to refer to any corpse (animate or otherwise), media such as ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' has spurred the portrayal of liches as powerful undead spellcasters that are proficient in necromancy, and typically undergo the transformation in order to defy death, allowing them to retain their intelligence and magical abilities and command lesser undead.

Where the liches of ''Dungeons & Dragons'' are depicted as revenants with undecaying and cadaverous, desiccated or completely skeletal bodies that are still tethered to the physical realm in some manner, the demilich is instead a floating skull or other skeletal body part (quite unlike the demilich of ''NetHack'') that uses astral projection to travel across other planes of existence, often as a result of attaining enough knowledge to transcend the need for a body. A lich can become a demilich by replacing eight small pieces of its body with soul gems - this usually takes the form of jeweled eyes and teeth in the lich's skull, but can also be joints in a hand or discs in the lich's spine. Once the power of the lich is focused in that part of its body, the rest of it crumbles away.

Demiliches in the ''Dungeons & Dragons'' settings are even more resilient to destruction than normal liches, and boast even stronger magical defenses as well. The eight gems effectively act as the demilich's phylactery, allowing the demilich to reappear within ten days of its "death" unless all eight gems and the phylactery are destroyed. One of the settings' most notorious demiliches is [[Acererak]], who is responsible in-universe for the construction of the similarly-infamous [[wikipedia:Tomb of Horrors|Tomb of Horrors]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], demiliches [[Need +x weapon to hit|need a +3 or better weapon]] to be hit, and [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit monsters as a +3 weapon themselves]].

Demiliches may appear among the random {{white|L}} generated in the [[Chaotic Quest]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], two demiliches appear within one of the rooms in [[Demogorgon]]'s lair if his dwelling appears as [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats#Demogorgon's palace|the third Abyss level]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], players killed by any type of lich will arise as a [[revenant]] instead of a [[ghost]] in [[bones]] files.

Two demiliches are generated on the first two floors of [[Vecna's Domain]] at level creation, and three are generated around Vecna's lair on the third floor, including one in a hidden storeroom that is generated atop an [[iron safe]] with two chests next to them; all the containers will have random loot. Vecna's presence in the dungeon prevents the genocide of demiliches - once he is destroyed, they can be subjected to genocide as normal.

Demiliches are much more dangerous compared to vanilla ''NetHack'', since they have access to several new monster spells especially at higher levels - like with other liches, this also makes them much better pets and polyforms, with full access to their repertoire of monster spells when fighting other monsters.

Sunsword now has a chance of instakilling any demiliches it hits. [[The Sword of Kas]] is an [[artifact]] [[gemstone]] [[two-handed]] sword that deals double damage versus {{white|L}}, including demiliches.
